alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Jackson County through 345 PM CDT... At 300 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near South Pittsburg, or near Bridgeport. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bridgeport, Bass, and Russell Cave National Monument. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
